intro: Lachnocaulon ekmanii, commonly known as the mountain morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces striking blue or violet flowers, which bloom in the early morning. The plant has a sprawling growth habit and features hairy stems and leaves. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soil. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
